@BobDole81 wrote:

NOURLOL:

You guys don’t know what simultaneous equations are? Lol, back to high school maths.

When I learned it, it was always referred to as systems of equations…when I saw simultaneous equations, I thought Ollie was going to talk about distributed computing for solving equations

I would recommend that you use some string validation in this, but, very nice

item.title: Simultaneous Equations
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[code]/**

  • An Simultaneous Equation Solver
  • Program Created by Ollie.
    */

import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;
import java.util.Scanner;

public class Solve {
public static float l1x, l2x, l3x, l4x, l1y, l2y, l3y, l4y, l1e, l2e, l3e, l4e, yans, xans, getx1, getx2, gety1, gety2;
public static String op, op2, yn;
static boolean b;

public static void main(String args[]) throws IOException {


    Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);
    BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System.in));

    System.out.println("\nEnter Informarion for Line 1\n");
    System.out.println("x");
    l1x = Float.parseFloat(scan.nextLine());
    System.out.println(l1x + " +/- ");
    op = in.readLine();
    System.out.println(l1x + "x " + op + " y");
    l1y = Float.parseFloat(scan.nextLine());
    System.out.println(l1x + "x " + op + " " + l1y + "y = ");
    l1e = Float.parseFloat(scan.nextLine());

    System.out.println("\nNow Enter Informarion for Line 2\n");

    System.out.println("x");
    l2x = Float.parseFloat(scan.nextLine());
    System.out.println(l2x + " +/- ");
    op2 = in.readLine();
    System.out.println(l2x + "x " + op2 + " y");
    l2y = Float.parseFloat(scan.nextLine());
    System.out.println(l2x + "x " + op2 + " " + l2y + "y = ");
    l2e = Float.parseFloat(scan.nextLine());

    String l1 = l1x + "x " + op + " " + l1y + "y = " + l1e;

    String l2 = l2x + "x " + op2 + " " + l2y + "y = " + l2e;

    System.out.println("Line1 = " + l1);
    System.out.println("Line2 = " + l2 + "\n");

    if (op != op2) {
        b = false;
    }

    if (op == op2) {
        b = true;
    }
    choose();

}

public static void choose() {
    if (b) {
        Solve2();
    } else if (!b) {
        Solve();
    }
}

public static void Solve() {
    System.out.println("The Signs are Different.\n");
    l3x = l2x * l1x;
    l3y = l1x * l2y;
    l3e = l1x * l2e;
    String l3 = l3x + "x " + op2 + " " + l3y + "y = " + l3e;
    System.out.println("Line3 = " + l3 + "\n");
    l4x = l1x - l3x;
    l4y = l3y - l1y;
    l4e = l3e - l1e;
    String l4 = l4y + "y = " + l4e;
    System.out.println("Line4 = " + l4 + "\n");
    yans = l4e / l4y;
    System.out.println("Y = " + yans);
    getx1 = yans * l1y;
    getx2 = l1e - getx1;
    xans = getx2 / l1x;
    System.out.println("X = " + xans);
}


public static void Solve2() {
    System.out.println("The Signs are the Same.\n");
    l3y = l1y * l2y;
    l3x = l1y * l1x;
    l3e = l1y * l1e;
    String l3 = l3x + "x " + op2 + " " + l3y + "y = " + l3e;
    System.out.println("Line3 = " + l3 + "\n");
    l4y = l2y - l3y;
    l4x = l2x - l3x;
    l4e = l2e - l3e;
    String l4 = l4x + "x = " + l4e;
    System.out.println("Line4 = " + l4 + "\n");
    xans = l4e / l4x;
    System.out.println("X = " + xans);
    gety1 = xans * l1x;
    gety2 = l1e - gety1;
    yans = gety2 / l1y;
    System.out.println("Y = " + yans);
}

}
[/code]

now there a piece of poo
